DataElement.preferredDefinition: A procedure or systematic course of actions used to detect a cyst, lesion, or malignant neoplasm.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A sac-like closed membranous structure that may be empty or contain fluid or amorphous material._A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A sac-like closed membranous structure that may be empty or contain fluid or amorphous material.:A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Concepts.definition: A sac-like closed membranous structure that may be empty or contain fluid or amorphous material.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/16/18 jk released per Kristen Anton; chg reg to "Qualified".  4/10/17 created for MCL Core. jk

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An asymptomatic benign or malignant lesion discovered during an endoscopic, surgical, or radiologic procedure performed for unrelated reasons.

Concepts.definition: An asymptomatic benign or malignant lesion discovered during an endoscopic, surgical, or radiologic procedure performed for unrelated reasons.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: Detected; perceived or discerned.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
